channel.title: Distance-Time Graph
channel.description:
I need to draw a Distance-Time Graph for a Motion Project in Physics and I am having some trouble in doing so with the help of Excel.
The table of values I need to plot are as follows: [table] [tr] [td]Distance (m) Time (mins) 0 0 1980 2.22 2160 2.39[/td] [/tr] [/table]
I need to plot each of the corresponding values as points, so, for example, (Time, Distance) and so (0,0), (2.22,1980) and (2.39,2160) are the 3 points that I need to plot. Just as additional information, the time scale is labelled on the x-axis and the distance scale is labelled on the y-axis, hence the x,y ordering, obviously.
The trouble I'm experiencing is in how to setup the table in Excel so that when I highlight the table and click on the Line Graph function, the Distance Time Graph will form with all 3 coordinate points shall we say with lines joining them respectively. I know I can easily edit the names of the axes later but the axes should be in proper scale and whatnot.
My question will probably have a simple answer to it but any help would be appreciated since I am pathetically struggling at this.
EDIT: Never mind, miraculously figured it out.

item.title: Distance-Time Graph
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

I need to draw a Distance-Time Graph for a Motion Project in Physics and I am having some trouble in doing so with the help of Excel.

The table of values I need to plot are as follows:
[table]
[tr]
[td]Distance (m) Time (mins)
0 0
1980 2.22
2160 2.39[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

I need to plot each of the corresponding values as points, so, for example, (Time, Distance) and so (0,0), (2.22,1980) and (2.39,2160) are the 3 points that I need to plot. Just as additional information, the time scale is labelled on the x-axis and the distance scale is labelled on the y-axis, hence the x,y ordering, obviously.

The trouble Iâ€™m experiencing is in how to setup the table in Excel so that when I highlight the table and click on the Line Graph function, the Distance Time Graph will form with all 3 coordinate points shall we say with lines joining them respectively. I know I can easily edit the names of the axes later but the axes should be in proper scale and whatnot.

My question will probably have a simple answer to it but any help would be appreciated since I am pathetically struggling at this.

EDIT: Never mind, miraculously figured it out.
